translation: Old Miscellaneous Parables Sutra, Vol. 1

source_sentence: 吳天竺三藏康僧會譯
translation: Wu translated by the Tripiṭaka of India, translated by Kang Senghui

source_sentence: （一）昔無數世有一商人，號曰薩薄，時適他國賣齎貨，所止近住佛弟子家。
translation: (1) Once upon a time, there was a merchant named Sadā who went to another country to sell goods and lived near the Buddha's disciple's home.

source_sentence: 佛弟子家時作大福，安施高座眾僧說法講論罪福，善惡由心身口所行，
translation: When the disciples of the Buddha make great merit at home, they place them in a high seat and teach the Dharma to the saṃgha. Good and evil deeds are done by their minds, bodies, and speech.

source_sentence: 及四諦非常苦空之法。
translation: and the four noble truths of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and dharmas.

source_sentence: 遠道賈人時來寄聽，心解信樂便受五戒，白優婆塞，上座以法勸樂之，
translation: When the merchants from distant places came to listen, their minds were free of faith and eager, so they accepted the five precepts. They said to the layman Upāsaka, “The superior monk encouraged them by means of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 言：「善男子！
translation: He said, Good man!

source_sentence: 護身口心十善具者，戒有五神，五戒有二十五神，現世衛護令無枉橫，
translation: He who guards the ten good provisions of body, speech, and mind is endowed with five moral precepts. The five precepts are endowed with twenty-five moral precepts; he protects them in the world so that they will not be unjustly abused.

source_sentence: 後世自致無為大道。」
translation: In later generations, they will themselves attain the path of nonproductivity.

source_sentence: 賈人聞法重喜無量，後還本國，國中都無佛法，便欲宣化恐無受者，以所受法教化父母兄弟妻子及諸中外，
translation: When the merchants heard the Dharma they were greatly delighted, and when they returned to their own country there was no buddha-dharma in that country. So they wished to propagate it but feared that none would accept it. By means of the Dharma they had received, they disciplined their parents, brothers, wives, and other members of the middle and lower classes.

source_sentence: 皆便奉法。
translation: They all then honored the teaching.

source_sentence: 去賈人土千里有國，民多豐樂寶物饒好，二國否塞絕不復通百餘年中，
translation: A thousand li away from the place where the merchants lived there was a country of abundant wealth and prosperity, rich in treasures and good fortune. For more than one hundred years the two kingdoms were unable to occupy or cut off communication.

source_sentence: 所以故有閱叉居其道中，得人便噉前後無數，是故斷絕無往來者。
translation: That's why there are yakṣas who live on that path, and when they attain it, the number of people before and after them become countless; therefore, there's no going or coming.

source_sentence: 賈人自念：「吾奉佛戒，如經所道，及有二十五神見助不疑，聽彼鬼唯一人耳，
translation: The merchant thought to himself, “I will obey the Buddha’s precepts and follow what is taught in the sutra. As well as the twenty-five deities who assisted me with my supernatural power of seeing without doubt, I heard that the ghost was only a human being.

source_sentence: 吾往伏之必獲也。」
translation: I'll surely subdue them if I go there.

source_sentence: 時有同賈五百餘人，便語眾人：「吾有異力能降伏鬼，汝等能行詣彼者，
translation: At that time, there were more than five hundred merchants of the same caste. They said to the crowd, “We have supernatural powers to subdue ghosts.

source_sentence: 不及有大利。」
translation: They won't attain great rewards.

source_sentence: 眾人自共議：「二國不通從來大久，若得達者所得不訾，便相可適進道而去。」
translation: The people themselves discussed it together, saying, It's been a long time since the two countries didn't pass through each other, and if someone attains understanding without anger, then they can go on their way.

source_sentence: 來至中路見鬼食處，人骸骨髮狼籍滿地，薩薄自念：「鬼神前後所可食人今證驗現，
translation: On his way there, he saw the place where the ghosts ate. The human skeletons and wolves were all buried on the ground. Sadāparibhūta thought to himself, “The ghosts and goddesses may have eaten people before me but now they are actually alive.

source_sentence: 我死職當，恐此眾人。」
translation: I'll die in my position, and I'm afraid of these people.

source_sentence: 便語眾輩：「汝等住此吾欲獨進，得勝鬼者當還相迎，不得來者知為遇害，
translation: He said to the assembly, “You must stay here. I wish to go on my own. Those who are victorious among the ghosts should return and meet each other. Those who cannot come back will know that they have been harmed.

source_sentence: 便各還退勿復進也。」
translation: They'll then each retreat and don't advance again.

source_sentence: 於是獨前，方行數里，逢見鬼來，正心念佛志定不懼。
translation: So he went out in front of the monastery alone for several li. When he saw a ghost approaching him, he concentrated his thoughts on the Buddha and was not frightened at all.

source_sentence: 鬼到問曰：「卿是何人？」
translation: When the ghost arrived, he asked, Who are you?

source_sentence: 答曰：「吾是通道導師也。」
translation: He replied, I'm the guide of the path.

source_sentence: 鬼大笑曰：「汝聞我名不？
translation: The ghost laughed and said, Have you heard my name?

source_sentence: 而欲通道。」
translation: They want to follow the path.

source_sentence: 薩薄曰：「知汝在此故來相求，當與卿鬪，若卿勝者便可食我，若我得勝，
translation: Sārthavāha said, “You know that this is the reason you came here to seek my food. I will fight with you. If you are victorious, eat me.

source_sentence: 通萬姓道，益天下利矣。」
translation: They share the path of myriad castes and clans, which will bring benefit to the world.

source_sentence: 鬼言：「誰應先下手乎？」
translation: The ghost said, Who should first touch it?

source_sentence: 賈人言：「吾來相求，故應先下。」
translation: The merchant said, I'll come to ask for it; therefore, I should go down first.

source_sentence: 鬼聽可之。
translation: The ghosts heard it and approved of it.

source_sentence: 以右手扠之，手入鬼腹堅不可出，左手復打亦入，如是兩脚及頭都入鬼中不能復動。
translation: When he strikes it with his right hand, his hand enters the demon's belly that's hard and can't be removed, and when he strikes it again with his left hand, his two feet and head enter into the demon and can't move again.

source_sentence: 「手足及與頭，　　五事雖絆覊，
translation: Their hands, feet, and heads are fettered by five things.

source_sentence: 但當前就死，　　跳踉復何為？」
translation: But what's the point of jumping and drowning when you're about to die?

source_sentence: 「手足及與頭，　　五事雖被繫，
translation: Their hands, feet, and heads are fettered by five things:

source_sentence: 執心如金剛，　　終不為汝擘。」
translation: They cling to the mind like adamantine, and they never break it for you.

source_sentence: 「吾為神中王，　　作鬼多力旅，
translation: I am the king of gods, traveling as a ghost with many powers.

source_sentence: 前後噉汝輩，　　不可復稱數。
translation: The former and latter are like your group, which cannot be counted again.

source_sentence: 今汝死在近，　　何為復讇語？
translation: Now that you're near death, why would you speak harshly?

source_sentence: 「是身為無常，　　吾早欲棄離，
translation: This body is impermanent, and I want to abandon it sooner.

source_sentence: 魔今適我願，　　便持相布施。
translation: Now that Māra has adapted to my wishes, he's holding his characteristics and making offerings.

source_sentence: 緣是得正覺，　　當成無上智，
translation: Conditioned by this attainment of right awakening, he’ll attain the unsurpassed knowledge.

source_sentence: 志妙摩訶薩，　　三界中希有。
translation: Marvelous is the aspiration of great beings, rare in the three realms.

source_sentence: 畢為度人師，　　得備將不久，
translation: Soon he will become a teacher of liberation, And before long he will be ready.

source_sentence: 願以身自歸，　　頭面禮稽首。」
translation: May I take refuge in my body, bowed my head and face, and bow my head.

source_sentence: 於是閱叉即以頌而問曰：於是閱叉前受五戒慈心眾生，即為作禮退入深山。
translation: The yakṣa then asked in verse, So the sentient beings who received the five precepts and were compassionate before the yakṣa with five precepts bowed to him and retreated into the deep mountains.

source_sentence: 薩薄還呼眾人，前進彼土，於是二國並知，五戒十善降鬼通道，乃識佛法至真無量，
translation: Again, Sārthavāha summoned the assembly of monks and proceeded to that land. Soon thereafter both countries became aware that the five precepts and the ten wholesome practices had conquered the realm of ghosthood, and they came to know that the buddha-dharma was immeasurable in terms of its ultimate truth.

source_sentence: 皆共奉戒延敬三尊國致太平。
translation: They all served the precepts together, honored the three honored kingdoms, and achieved peace.

source_sentence: 後昇天得道，乃五戒賢者直信之恩力也。
translation: Subsequently, he ascended to heaven and attained the Way, which was the result of the kindness of the five virtuous men of morality who directly believed in him.

source_sentence: 佛告諸比丘：「時薩薄者我身是。
translation: The Buddha told the monks, That's me at the time of Sārthavāha.

source_sentence: 菩薩行尸波羅蜜，所度如是。」
translation: The bodhisattva's practice of śīla-pāramitā is thus liberated.

source_sentence: （二）過去無數劫，爾時有孔雀王，從五百婦孔雀，相隨經歷諸山，見青雀色大好，
translation: (2) In an incalculably long eon in the past, there was a king of peacocks at that time. Accompanied by five hundred female peacocks, they traveled among themselves through the mountains and saw blue-colored large and beautiful birds.

source_sentence: 便捨五百婦追青雀，青雀但食甘露好果。
translation: He then abandoned the five hundred wives and pursued the blue bird, which simply ate the good fruit of ambrosia.

source_sentence: 時國王夫人有疾，夜夢見孔雀王，寤則白王：「王當重募求之。」
translation: When the king's wife was ill, she dreamed of a peacock king in a night and said to the king, The king will solicit it again.

source_sentence: 王命射師：「有能得孔雀王來者，賜金百斤；
translation: The king ordered his archer, “If you can find the peacock king coming, give me a hundred catties of gold.

source_sentence: 婦以女女之。」
translation: The woman gave it to her as a woman.

source_sentence: 諸射師分布諸山，見孔雀從一青雀，便以蜜麨處處塗樹。
translation: When the archers were distributing among the mountains, they saw a peacock coming from a blue bird and then rubbing it against a tree with honeycomb.

source_sentence: 孔雀日日為青雀取食，如是玩習，人便以蜜麨塗己身，孔雀便取蜜麨，
translation: Every day, the peacock takes food for the blue bird and plays like this. People then rub it over their bodies with a piece of honey and the peacock takes another piece of honey.

source_sentence: 人則得之。
translation: People then attain it.

source_sentence: 語人言：「我以一山金相與，可捨我。」
translation: He said to the people, I'll give you a mountain of gold, so you can abandon me.

source_sentence: 人言：「王與我金并婦，足可自畢已。」
translation: The people said, The king will give me my gold and my wife, and I'll have enough to finish it for myself.

source_sentence: 便持白王。
translation: He then held it and told the king.

source_sentence: 孔雀白大王：「王重愛夫人故相取，願乞水來呪之，與夫人飲澡浴，若不差者相殺不晚。」
translation: The peacock said to the great king, The king loves his wife so much that he takes her and wishes to ask for water to curse her, give her a drink and bath, and if he doesn't do so, they'll kill each other without delay.

source_sentence: 王則與水令呪，授與夫人飲，病則除。
translation: The king then gave water to make a spell, gave it to the lady to drink, and she was cured of her illness.

source_sentence: 宮中內外諸有百病，皆因此水悉得除愈，國王人民來取水者無央數。
translation: All the hundreds of illnesses inside and outside the palace were healed by this water, and there were measureless numbers of kings and people who came to fetch water.

source_sentence: 孔雀白大王：「寧可木繫我足，自在往來湖水中方呪，令民遠近自恣取水。」
translation: The peacock said to the great king, Let's rather bind my feet with wood and follow the spell at the side of the lake water wherever you like, so that people from far and near can freely get water for themselves.

source_sentence: 王言大佳。
translation: The king said, Great!

source_sentence: 則引木入湖水中，自極制方呪之，人民飲水，聾盲視聽跛傴皆伸。
translation: He then led the wood into the lake water and cursed it with his own supernatural powers. The people drank the water but the deaf, blind, dumb, hearing, and crippled were all stretched out.

source_sentence: 孔雀白大王：「國中諸惡病悉得除愈，人民供養我如天神無異，終無去心。
translation: The peacock said to the great king, All the bad illnesses in my country will be healed, and the people will make offerings to me like gods and goddesses without any difference, never leaving their minds.

source_sentence: 大王可解我足，使得飛往來入入湖水中，暝止此梁上宿。」
translation: The great king, please untie my legs and allow me to flee, enter the lake, and sojourn on this bridge for the night.

source_sentence: 王則令解之，如是數月於梁上大笑。
translation: The king then ordered him to untie it, and for several months he laughed loudly above the Liang.

source_sentence: 王問曰：「汝何等笑？」
translation: The king asked, What are you laughing at?

source_sentence: 答曰：「我笑天下有三癡：一曰我癡，二曰獵師癡，三曰王癡。
translation: He answered, There are three kinds of delusion that make me laugh in the world: 1. delusion about self, 2. delusion about hunters, and 3. delusion about kings.

source_sentence: 我與五百婦相隨，捨追青雀，貪欲之意為射獵者所得，是為我癡。
translation: I am accompanied by five hundred wives, abandoning and chasing a blue bird. The desire for it is what the hunter or marksman obtains out of craving. This is my delusion.

source_sentence: 射獵人我與一山金不取，言王當與己婦并金，是射獵者癡。
translation: A hunter-gatherer who says, 'I gave a mountain of gold to a woman and didn't take it, saying that the king will give his wife some gold,' is a hunter-gatherer's delusion.

source_sentence: 王得神醫王，夫人太子國中人民諸有病者，悉得除愈皆更端正，王既得神醫，
translation: The king attained the king of divine medicine, and all the sick people in his kingdom were cured from their illnesses. The prince’s queen-in-waiting queen had a divine doctor who was able to treat them without difficulty.

source_sentence: 而不牢持反縱放之，是為王癡。」
translation: Not holding it in reverse and releasing it freely is the king's delusion.

source_sentence: 孔雀便飛去。
translation: The peacock then flew away.

source_sentence: 佛告舍利弗：「時孔雀王者我身是也，時國王汝身是，時夫人者今調達婦是，
translation: The Buddha said to Śāriputra: At that time the king of the peacocks was none other than I myself; you were none other than me. The queen at that time was none other than your majesty.

source_sentence: 時獵師者調達是也。」
translation: That's the hunter of the time who tamed it.

source_sentence: （三）昔有國王，行射獵於曠澤中，大飢渴疲極，遙望欝然有屋樹木，
translation: (3) Once, there was a king who practiced archery and hunting in the wild marshlands of great hunger and thirst.

source_sentence: 即往趣之。
translation: He then went to him.

source_sentence: 中有一女人，王從求飲食果實之輩，所求悉得。
translation: There was a woman among them, and the king obtained whatever he wanted from those who were seeking food, drink, or fruit.

source_sentence: 王請女人與相見，侍人白言：「裸形無衣。」
translation: The king invited the woman to see him, and the attendants said, They're naked without clothing.

source_sentence: 王即解衣與之，有自然火燒衣，如是至三。
translation: The king then dismounted from his robe and gave it to him, and there was a spontaneous fire that burned his robe, which went so far as three times.

source_sentence: 王驚問女：「何因如此？」
translation: The king was startled and asked the woman, What is the reason for this?

source_sentence: 女人答言：「前世為王妻，王飯沙門梵志，又欲上衣，我時言：『但設飯則可，
translation: The woman replied, “In a previous existence I was the king’s wife. When the king gave food to renunciants and brahmins, he also wanted upper garments. At that time I said:

source_sentence: 不須與衣。』
translation: They don't need to give them their robes.'

source_sentence: 故受此罪。
translation: That's why they're subject to this sin.

source_sentence: 若王相念，作衣與國中沙門道士，若曉佛經者，呪願女人得脫此勤苦。」
translation: If the king thinks of each other, makes a robe and gives it to the country's ascetic or religious practitioner, and if he understands the Buddha's sūtras, he prays that the woman will be freed from this painful suffering.

source_sentence: 王受其言，還國作衣，求沙門道人了不得。
translation: Accepting these words, the king returned home and made his robes, but he asked the ascetic monk to make them so that they could not be accepted.

source_sentence: 時國無曉佛經者，王憶念，問舍度父當知之。
translation: The king of that country had no knowledge of the Buddha's sūtras, so he remembered them and asked Śākyamuni to save his father, who should be known.

source_sentence: 度父言：「乃昔有人度無錢，以五戒經一卷相與讀之耳。」
translation: He excused his father, saying, In the past, there was a man who had no money and gave one volume of the five precepts sūtras to someone to read with him.

source_sentence: 王言：「汝知佛經則以衣與。」
translation: The king said, You know the Buddha's sūtras and give them with your robes.

source_sentence: 度父使呪願：「令倮形女人得福無量解脫勤苦。」
translation: He saves his father's messenger and wishes, May a woman of crude form attain merit and immeasurable liberation from suffering and hardship.

source_sentence: 女人則時有新衣著身，故在鬼道中命盡，當生第一天上也。
translation: When a woman's new clothes are worn on her body, she's in the ghostly path and when her life ends, she'll be born on the first ground.

source_sentence: （四）昔海邊有國王行射獵，得一沙門，持作使沙門夜誦經作梵聲，王言：「此伎大工歌，
translation: (4) Once, there was a king at the seaside who was engaged in hunting and shooting. He had an ascetic accompanied by his messengers to recite scriptures that were written in Sanskrit for him at night. The king said, “This is a song of great craftsmanship.

source_sentence: 有客輒伎歌。」
translation: If there are guests, they'll sing a song of skillful means.

source_sentence: 時有異國優婆塞賈，往到其國，王請之，出沙門令歌。
translation: A layman from another country then went to that country, invited by the king, and expelled the ascetic to sing.

source_sentence: 優婆塞聞說深經，內心踊躍即去，國人以千萬往贖，至三千萬王乃與之，
translation: When the layman heard this profound discourse he jumped inward and departed. The people of that country offered him a thousand pieces of gold coin to the king, who gave them to him at the rate of thirty-thousand [Chinese] guilties.

source_sentence: 賈人作禮曰：「我以三千萬相贖在所到。」
translation: The merchant paid homage and said, I'll redeem 3,000 marks wherever I go.

source_sentence: 道人即彈指踊在空中，曰：「卿自贖，不贖我也。
translation: The monk then snapped his fingers and flew up into the air, saying, You redeem yourself, but you won't redeem me.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 往昔王為賣葱人，汝來於王買葱不畢三錢，我時任卿，卿遂不還三錢。
translation: In the past, when the king was selling onions for you, you came to the king and bought an onion for less than three coins. When I asked you to do so, you didn't return three coins.

source_sentence: 今此生子息，乃至三千萬，汝當還本三錢也。」
translation: Now that this newborn child has ceased, up to 30,000, you'll return the original three coins.

source_sentence: 主則意解悔過，受五戒為優婆塞。
translation: The lord then resolved to repent and accepted the five precepts as a layman.

source_sentence: 師曰：「債無多少不可負，亦不任人也。」
translation: The teacher said, There's no amount of debt to be owed, and I won't let anyone take it.

source_sentence: （五）佛在世，有小兒與兄嫂共居，兒日日至佛所受經戒，兄嫂諫不止。
translation: (5) When the Buddha was in the world, there was a young boy living together with his brothers and sisters, who went to the Buddha's place every day to receive the sūtras and precepts, and their brothers and sisters didn't stop remonstrating.

source_sentence: 後取兒牽抱之，以杖捶之言：「佛比丘僧當救汝。」
translation: He then took his child, held him in his arms, flogged him with a stick, and said, The buddhas, monks, and nuns will rescue you.

source_sentence: 兒啼呼恐怖，自歸三尊，則得須陀洹道，乘佛威神，便與木抱縛相隨俱飛去，
translation: The boy cried in fear and, taking refuge in the Three Revered Ones, he attained the path of stream-entry. Using the Buddha’s supernatural power, he flew away accompanied by Mahāprajāpatīṃṣṭacāritra and departed at once.

source_sentence: 出壁入壁出地入地自在所為。
translation: He exits walls, enters walls, leaves the ground, and enters the ground freely.

source_sentence: 兄嫂見之，惶怖叩頭悔過，兒便為兄嫂說善惡之行，俱到佛所受戒。
translation: When the brothers and sisters saw this, they bowed their heads in fear and repented. The boy then told his brothers and sisters about good and bad deeds, and they all went to the Buddha to receive the precepts.

source_sentence: 佛則為現宿命本末，兄嫂歡喜，心開垢除，得須陀洹道。
translation: The Buddha then manifested the original destinies of past lives, and his brothers and sisters rejoiced, opened their minds, removed their defilements, and attained the stream entry path.

source_sentence: （六）昔有羅漢，與沙彌於山中行道，沙彌日日至道人家取飯。
translation: (6) Once, there was an arhat who traveled the path with a śrāmaṇer in the mountains, and the śrāmaṇer went to the house of the path every day to get food.

source_sentence: 道經歷堤基上行，崎嶇危嶮常躃地覆飯污泥土，沙彌取不污飯著師鉢中，
translation: On the way he climbed up the embanks of the river and proceeded on a precipitous path. He always covered his rice bowl with dirty clay so as to wash away the mud; but the novice put un soiled rice in his master’s almsbowl.

source_sentence: 取污飯澡洗食之，如是非一日。
translation: He takes the defiled rice, bathes it, washes it, and eats it, just as he did for a day.

source_sentence: 師曰：「何因澡棄飯味？」
translation: The teacher said, Why did you wash away the taste of rice?

source_sentence: 答曰：「行乞去時晴還雨，於堤基躃地覆飯。」
translation: He answered, When he's going to beg, it's clear and raining back when he leaves, covering his rice on the ground at the embankment.

source_sentence: 師默然禪思之，知是龍嬈沙彌，便起到堤上，持杖叩擻之。
translation: Knowing that this was a dragon disturbing the śrāmaṇer, he ascended to the embankment and stooped on it with his staff.

source_sentence: 龍化作老翁來，頭面著地。
translation: The dragon transformed into an old man and came, his head and face touching the ground.

source_sentence: 沙門言：「汝何因嬈我沙彌乎？」
translation: The monk said, Why are you disturbing me as a novice?

source_sentence: 答曰：「不敢嬈，實愛其容貌耳。」
translation: He replied, I wouldn't dare to disturb him; I really love his appearance.

source_sentence: 龍言：「何以日見其行？」
translation: The dragon said, How did you see his practice in the sun?

source_sentence: 師曰：「行乞飯。」
translation: The teacher said, I'm going to beg for food.

source_sentence: 龍言：「從今日為始，願日日於我室食，畢我壽命。」
translation: The dragon said, From today for the beginning, I wish to eat in my room every day and finish my life.

source_sentence: 沙門默然受請。
translation: The ascetic remained silent and accepted the invitation.

source_sentence: 還語沙彌：「汝往乞，止彼食，勿復持飯來。」
translation: He returned and said to the novice, Go ask them to stop eating and don't bring any more food.

source_sentence: 沙彌日日於彼食，後見師鉢中有兩三粒飯，香美非世間飯，問和上曰：「於天上飯乎？」
translation: When the novice was eating there every day, he saw two or three grains of rice in his teacher's bowl and asked the monk, Is it food from heaven?

source_sentence: 師默不應。
translation: The teacher remained silent and didn't respond.

source_sentence: 沙彌便伺師知於何許飯，便入床下持床足，和上坐禪定意，床相隨俱飛到龍七寶殿上，
translation: The śrāmaṇer waited for the master to tell him where to find some food. Then he entered the footstool of the couch under the bed and took his seat at the feet of the couch.

source_sentence: 龍及婦諸婇女，俱為沙門作禮，復為沙彌作禮。
translation: Both the dragon and the women and nymphs bowed to the ascetic, and they also bowed to the ascetic.

source_sentence: 師乃覺呼出：「正汝心勿動，此非常之像，何因污意？」
translation: The teacher then awakened and called out, Don't move your mind; what is the cause for this extraordinary image that defiles your mind?

source_sentence: 飯已即將還，語之：「彼雖有殿舍七寶婦人婇女，故為畜生耳。
translation: After he had finished his meal, he returned and said to her, Even though there's a seven-jeweled palace with women and girls in it, they're therefore animals.

source_sentence: 汝為沙彌，雖未得道，必生忉利天上，勝彼百倍，勿以污意。」
translation: Even though you're a novice, even if you haven't attained the path, you'll surely be born in Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, which is a hundred times greater than that, so don't defile your mind.

source_sentence: 語沙彌言：「此百味飯入口即化成蝦蟆，意惡吐唾，逆反已乃却，飯不復入。
translation: He said to the śrāmaṇer, This hundred-flavored rice is transformed into a frog and toad when he eats it.

source_sentence: 二曰婦女端正無比，欲為夫婦禮，化成兩蛇相交。
translation: The second is that the women are incomparably handsome. Desiring to be married, they transform into two snakes and intercourse with each other.

source_sentence: 三曰龍背有逆鱗，沙石生其中，痛乃達心胸。
translation: The third is that the dragon’s back has opposing scales. Sand and stones grow on its back, and pain reaches up to the heart and chest.

source_sentence: 龍有此三苦，汝何因欲之？」
translation: Why do you want these three kinds of suffering for a dragon, and why do you want them?

source_sentence: 沙彌不應，遂晝夜思想，於彼不食，得病而死。
translation: The novice shouldn't, so he spent his days and nights thinking about it. If he doesn't eat it, he'll get sick and die.

source_sentence: 魂神即生為龍作子，威神致猛，其父命盡得脫生人中，師曰：「人未得道，
translation: The spirit of soul was born and became the son of a dragon. His powers were so powerful that when his father’s life came to an end he could be reborn as a human being.

source_sentence: 不可令見，道及國王內也。」
translation: They won't be allowed to see it, either in the path or within the kingdom.

source_sentence: （七）昔有國王夫人生一女，父母名為月女，端正無比，王與衣被珍寶，
translation: (7) Once upon a time, there was a king who gave birth to a daughter named Moon Woman by the name of her parents. Her beauty was incomparable and the king gave her clothing and precious treasures.

source_sentence: 輒言自然也。
translation: It's easy to say it's natural.

source_sentence: 至年十六，王恚言：「此是我與，汝何言自然？」
translation: When he was sixteen years old, the king said in anger, This is my gift; why do you say it's natural?

source_sentence: 後有乞兒來丐，王言：「此實汝夫。」
translation: Later, a beggar came to the king and said, This is really your husband.

source_sentence: 月女言諾。
translation: The moon-maiden promised.

source_sentence: 自然便追去。
translation: Naturally, they'll chase it away.

source_sentence: 乞人惶怖不敢取，女言：「汝乞食常不飽，王與汝婦何為讓？」
translation: The beggar was frightened and didn't dare to take it, and the woman said, You're always begging for food but you won't get enough; why would the king give it to your wife?

source_sentence: 便俱出城，晝藏夜進，行到大國。
translation: So they all left the city and proceeded day and night through the storehouse to the great kingdom.

source_sentence: 國王時崩無太子，夫婦於城外坐，出入行人問曰：「何等人汝何姓名？
translation: When the king died without a prince, the couple sat outside the city and travelers came out and asked, Who are you? What's your name?

translation: Where did you come from?

source_sentence: 答曰：「自然。」
translation: He answered, Naturally.

source_sentence: 如是十餘日。
translation: For more than ten days, he did so.

source_sentence: 時大臣使梵志八人於都城門行人出入以次相之，「唯有此夫婦應相耳。」
translation: The minister then asked the priests to send eight people who were walking at the entrance of the capital city to enter and exit in order, saying, Only this husband and wife should be seen.

source_sentence: 是時舉國群臣共奉迎之為王。
translation: The ministers of the state then joined together to greet him as king.

source_sentence: 王夫婦以正法治國，人民安寧，諸小王來朝。
translation: The king and his wife ruled the country correctly. The people were peaceful and the lesser kings came to court.

source_sentence: 月女父王在中飲食已去，月女特留父王，月女以七寶作魚機關，帳牽一魚百二十魚現，
translation: The moon-maiden's father, the king of the goddesses, ate and departed while she was there. The moon-maiden specially kept her father as king; and the moon-maiden made a fish trap out of the seven kinds of treasure to catch one hundred and twenty pieces of fish in the net.

source_sentence: 推一魚戶則開，下為父作禮，白父：「今已得自然。」
translation: He pushed out a fish door and opened it, bowed to his father, and said to him, Now you've gotten it naturally.

source_sentence: 曰：「夫人行然，臣不及矣。」
translation: He said, The lady's conduct is such that the ministers aren't up to it.

source_sentence: 師曰：「月女與乞兒宿命，夫婦俱田作，令婦取餉，夫遙見婦與沙門相逢於岸水邊止，
translation: The teacher said, “The moon-maiden and the beggar were engaged in a night together. When they saw from a distance that the queen was meeting with the śramaṇa, they stopped by the riverbank.

source_sentence: 從乞婦食，則分飯上道人，道人止飯。
translation: When he begs for food from a woman, he divides it into rice and gives it to the superior practitioner of the Way, who stops eating.

source_sentence: 夫遙見兩人，不謂有惡，持杖往見，道人飛去。
translation: When he saw the two people from a distance, he didn't say there was evil. He took his staff and went to see them, and the monk fled.

source_sentence: 婦言：『卿分自在，勿恚。』
translation: The woman said, 'You're at liberty, don't fight.'

source_sentence: 夫言：『兩分者，我與共食也。』」
translation: When someone says, 'Two parts, I'll share the food with you.'

source_sentence: 師曰：「夫有惡意，故墮貧家作子，後見道人歡喜自悔責故，同受此福耳。」
translation: The teacher said, A man with bad intentions falls into a poor family as a child and later sees the monk rejoice because he repents of his sins, so he'll experience this merit together.

source_sentence: （八）昔佛從眾比丘行，逢三醉人，一人走入草中逃；
translation: (8) Once, when the Buddha was traveling with the monks, he met three drunken people. One of them ran into the grass and fled.

source_sentence: 一人正坐博頰言無狀犯戒；
translation: One person sat cross-legged and said he had violated the precepts.

source_sentence: 一人起舞曰：「我亦不飲佛酒漿，亦何畏乎？」
translation: One person got up to dance and said, I won't drink the Buddha's wine or juice, so why would I be afraid?

source_sentence: 佛謂阿難：「草中逃人，彌勒作佛時當得應真度脫，正坐博頰人，過千佛當於最後佛得應真度脫，
translation: When Maitreya becomes a buddha, he will be liberated according to reality. If he is seated correctly like a man with white cheeks, then after one thousand buddhas have passed, he will be liberated according to reality at the last buddha.

translation: The dancer who rises up doesn't want to be liberated.

source_sentence: 昔有沙門，晝夜誦經，有狗伏床下，一心聽經不復念食，如是積年，命盡得人形，
translation: Formerly a śramaṇa recited the sutras day and night, while a dog was lying on his bed. He listened to the sutras with one mind and did not think of food again. For many years in this way he attained human form when his life came to an end.

source_sentence: 生舍衛國中作女人。
translation: She was born in the country of Śrāvastī and became a woman.

source_sentence: 長大見沙門分越，便走自持飯與歡喜。
translation: When he grew up, seeing the ascetic's partial transgression, he ran away with his own rice and rejoiced.

source_sentence: 如是後便追沙門去，作比丘尼，精進得應真道也。
translation: After this, he then chased the ascetic away and became a bhikṣuṇī, exerting himself to attain the true path.

source_sentence: （九）昔維衛佛在世時，國中諸大姓，各各一時供佛及比丘眾。
translation: (9) In the past, when Vipaśyin Buddha was in the world, the great clansmen of the country each made offerings to the Buddha and the monks at one time.

source_sentence: 時有一大姓，貧無以供佛者，白言：「願比丘眾有欲得藥者，某悉當給之。」
translation: A large family of monks who were poor and didn't have money to offer to the Buddha said, May I give it to anyone among the monks who wants to obtain medicine?

source_sentence: 時有一比丘，身體有疾，大姓以一甘果與之食，比丘得安隱除愈。
translation: When there was a monk with a illness in his body, the great family gave him a sweet fruit to eat, and the monk was cured by being peaceful and cured.

source_sentence: 大姓後壽盡生天上，勝諸天有五事：一者身無病，二者端正，三者命長，
translation: The first is the absence of illness in one’s body. The second is physical well-being. The third is longevity.

source_sentence: 四者得財富，五者智慧。
translation: The fourth is the attainment of wealth and the fifth is wisdom.

source_sentence: 如是九十一劫中上為天、下生大姓家，不墮三惡道。
translation: Thus, for ninety-one eons, they'll be born in a heavenly family or a great family below them and won't fall into the three bad destinies.

source_sentence: 乃至釋迦文佛時，為四姓家作子名曰多寶，見佛歡喜，作沙門精進得道，
translation: Even at the time of Śākyamuni Buddha, he became a son named Prabhūtaratna for the sake of the fourfold householders. Seeing the Buddha, he was delighted and became a renunciant, striving hard to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 號為應真。
translation: His name was Yingzhen.

source_sentence: 夫施高行沙門一踰波邪，穢濁一國人矣。
translation: A monk who gives alms to a high-ranking ascetic is one yojana of error, and he's defiled by being a native of one country.

source_sentence: 昔有夫婦，俱持五戒事沙門。
translation: Formerly there were two husband and wife who both observed the five precepts and served as śramaṇas.

source_sentence: 有新學比丘不知經，至其門乞，夫婦請道人前坐，作飯食已畢，夫婦俱下地作禮言：「少小事道人，
translation: A newly ordained bhikṣu who did not know the scripture came to his door to ask for almsfood. The two married couples invited the monks of the Way to take their seats in front of them. source_sentence: 未曾聞經，願開解蔽闇不及。」
translation: I've never heard a sūtra before, and I wish to uncover the darkness of ignorance.

source_sentence: 比丘低頭無以答，曰：「苦哉苦哉！」
translation: The monk bowed his head and didn't have a reason to answer, saying, How painful!

source_sentence: 夫婦心意俱解，言：「世間實苦。」
translation: The husband and wife both understood their minds and said, Really painful worldly suffering.

source_sentence: 應時俱得道迹。
translation: They'll all attain the traces of the path at the right time.

source_sentence: 比丘見兩人歡喜，亦得道迹也。
translation: The monks were delighted to see that the two men also attained the traces of the Way.

source_sentence: 師曰：「宿命累世三人兄弟，願學道迹，同行故俱道證。」
translation: The teacher said, In past lives, there were three brothers who wished to study the traces of the path and shared the realization of the path because they traveled together.

source_sentence: （一〇）昔有國王，出射獵還，過繞塔，為沙門作禮，群臣共笑之。
translation: (10) Once, there was a king who went out to shoot and hunt and returned, circumambulated the stūpa, paid homage to the ascetic, and his ministers laughed together.

source_sentence: 王覺知，問群臣：「有金在釜，釜沸中以手取，可得不？」
translation: Knowing this, the king asked the ministers, Is there gold in the cauldron and can you get it if you take it with your hand from the boiling cauldron?

source_sentence: 答曰：「不可得。」
translation: He replied, They can't get it.

source_sentence: 王言：「汝冷水投中，可得不？」
translation: The king said, Can you throw cold water into it?

source_sentence: 臣白王：「可得也。」
translation: The ministers said to the king, It's possible.

source_sentence: 王言：「我行王事，射獵所作如湯沸，燒香然燈繞塔，如持冷水投沸湯中。
translation: The king said, I'm engaged in the king's business, and what I do as a hunter is like boiling water that burns an incense stick around a stūpa or throwing cold water into boiling water.

source_sentence: 夫作王，有善惡之行，何可但有惡無善乎？」
translation: If you're a king, how can you have good and bad actions that are only bad and not good?

source_sentence: （一一）昔有沙門行至他國，夜不得入城，於外草中坐。
translation: (1) Once, there was an ascetic who traveled to another country but couldn't enter the city at night and sat outside in grass.

source_sentence: 至夜閱叉鬼來持之：「當噉汝。」
translation: At night, the yakṣa spirits came to take it and said, I'll eat you.

source_sentence: 沙門言：「相離遠。」
translation: The ascetic said, They're far from each other.

source_sentence: 鬼言：「何以為遠？」
translation: The ghost said, Why is it so distant?

source_sentence: 沙門言：「汝害我，我當生忉利天上，汝當入地獄中，是不為遠也？」
translation: The monk said, If you harm me, I'll be born in Trāyastriṃśa gods, and you'll go to hell; isn't it far away?

source_sentence: 鬼則置，辭謝作禮而去。
translation: The ghost then withdrew, apologized, paid homage, and departed.

source_sentence: （一二）昔有國王，令人呼知識，知識言謝王：「適穿地作坑，欲藏七寶。」
translation: (12) Once, there was a king of a country who summoned his friends and said to the king, I'm going to make a pit through the ground in order to store seven treasures.

source_sentence: 王聞大驚，令人復呼知識，白王：「今適下寶著坑中。」
translation: The king was greatly frightened when he heard this and asked his friends to call him again, Telling the king, Now, let's put the treasure down in the pit.

source_sentence: 王便復令呼知識，白王：「今適下平地，平地已便往。」
translation: The king then again summoned his friends and said to the king, Now, I'll go down to the level ground, and after reaching the level ground, I'll go.

source_sentence: 王問：「汝何癡？
translation: The king asked, What's wrong with you?

source_sentence: 藏七寶以語人耶？」
translation: Is the store of the seven treasures to tell people?

source_sentence: 知識言：「屬饌具甘美，欲飯佛及比丘僧，是為穿地作坑。
translation: The friends said, This is a pit that penetrates the ground and creates a pit when they want to feed the Buddha and the monks.

source_sentence: 斟布羹飯，是為下寶坑中。
translation: To fill it with soup and rice is to go down into the treasure pit.

source_sentence: 掃地行澡水羼經，是為平地。」
translation: To sweep the ground and walk, bathe water, and soap the sutra is a level ground.

source_sentence: 白王：「此寶五家不能辱也。」
translation: He said to the king, These treasures can't be disgraced by the five families.

source_sentence: 王言：「善哉善哉！
translation: The king said, Good, good!

source_sentence: 汝不當早相告。
translation: You shouldn't tell me sooner.

source_sentence: 我當早相告，我當數藏寶。」
translation: I'll tell you sooner, and I'll store the treasures.

source_sentence: 王則開藏大布施，飯佛及比丘僧，佛為說清淨呪願，即發道意矣。
translation: The king then opened the storehouse and made a great offering to feed the Buddha and the monks, and the Buddha preached pure dhāraṇī vows for them, which would give rise to the aspiration for enlightenment.

source_sentence: （一三）昔有四姓請佛飯。
translation: (13) Once, there were four castes who invited the Buddha to eat.

translation: At that time a man was selling cow dung. His great clanswoman stayed to eat the rice and taught him how to observe the precepts and listen to the scriptures. The guest then returned home.

translation: The woman said, I'll wait for you in the morning without food.

translation: He then forcibly ordered the husband to eat rice and disrupted his mind of purification.

translation: Even so, there are seven births in heaven and seven births in the world.

source_sentence: 師曰：「一日持齋，有六十萬歲糧，復有五福：一曰少病，二曰身安隱，
translation: The teacher said, “If one observes a day of purification for sixty-thousand myriad years, there will be five kinds of blessings:

source_sentence: 三曰少婬意，四曰少睡臥，五曰得生天上常識宿命所行也。」
translation: The third is having little anger, the fourth is having little sleep and lying down, and the fifth is being born in heaven with a common sense of what they did in their past lives.

source_sentence: （一四）佛及比丘眾應請，有一沙門與一沙彌後來。
translation: (24) When the Buddha and the monks were invited, there was an ascetic and a novice who came after him.

translation: Dao met with a woman of sexual passion who led the ascetic, and the ascetic gave her to him because he had desires. He wanted to finish his journey and go to the rice house.

translation: The Buddha called the śrāmaṇer, Go down to Sumeru and fetch the sweet spring below.

source_sentence: 沙彌已得道，便挑鉢於前叉手追，須臾得水來還。
translation: After he had attained the path, the novice picked up his bowl and placed it in front of him, folded his palms together to chase after him, and returned with water for a moment.

source_sentence: 其師慚愧踧踖，悔過自責即得羅漢。
translation: The teacher was shameful and ashamed, repented of his sins, and self-reproached, and then attained arhatship.

translation: This woman was confronted by a man in the past, and when she meets him, she'll be punished and then attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: 昔阿育王，日飯千羅漢，後有來年少沙門，與千道人俱入宮。
translation: Formerly King Aśoka fed a thousand arhats every day. Later, there came a young śramaṇa who entered the palace accompanied by one thousand religious practitioners.

source_sentence: 年少沙門坐已，上下視王宮殿，復視正夫人不休。

translation: The king had an argument, and they each departed after the meal. The king invited the three attendants to his seat and asked, Where did this young man come from?

translation: What's the name?

source_sentence: 王言：「寶物自多，願曉百畜獸所語耳。」
translation: The king said, Since there are so many treasures, may I hear what a hundred animals say?

source_sentence: 龍王言：「當齋七日，七日訖來語，慎勿令人知也。」
translation: The dragon king said, You must observe the seven days of purification for seven days and finish speaking after seven days, so be careful not to let others know.

source_sentence: 如是王與夫人共飯，見蛾雌語雄取飯，雄言：「各自取。」
translation: Thus, the king and his wife shared food with each other, and when they saw the moth's female saying to the lion to take the rice, the lion said, Each one takes it.

source_sentence: 雌言：「我腹不便。」
translation: The woman said, My belly isn't comfortable.

source_sentence: 王失笑，夫人言：「王何因笑？」
translation: The king lost his smile, and the lady said, What's the reason for the king's smile?

source_sentence: 王默然，後與夫人俱坐，見蛾緣壁相逢，諍共鬪墮地，王復失笑。
translation: The king remained silent, and then he sat with his wife. Seeing that the moths met each other at the wall, they fought and fell to the ground. The king again lost his laughter.

source_sentence: 夫人言：「何等笑？」
translation: The lady said, What's the laughter?

source_sentence: 如是至三，言：「我不語汝。」
translation: He did so up to three times and said, I won't tell you.

source_sentence: 夫人言：「王不相語者我當自殺。」
translation: The lady said, If the king doesn't talk to each other, I'll kill myself.

source_sentence: 王言：「待我行還語汝。」
translation: The king said, Wait for me to go and tell you back.

source_sentence: 王便出行。
translation: The king then went on his journey.

source_sentence: 龍王化作數百頭羊度水，有懷妊牸羊呼羝羊：「汝還迎我。」
translation: The dragon king transformed into several hundred-headed sheep to cross the water, and a pregnant goat called out to the goat, Come back to meet me.

source_sentence: 羝羊言：「我極不能度汝。」
translation: The hungry sheep said, I can't save you at all.

source_sentence: 牸言：「汝不度我，我自殺。
translation: The brahman said, “If you do not save me, I will kill myself.

source_sentence: 汝不見國王當為婦死。」
translation: If you don't see the king, she'll die as a woman.

source_sentence: 羝羊言：「此王癡為婦死耳，汝便死謂我無牸羊也。」
translation: The gnawing sheep said, This king's delusion is about the death of a woman, so you'll die saying that I have no gnawing sheep.

source_sentence: 王聞之，王念：「我為一國王，不及羊智乎？」
translation: When the king heard this, the king thought, Am I the king of a country that's not as intelligent as a sheep?

source_sentence: 王歸，夫人言：「王不為說者當自殺耳。」
translation: When the king returned, the queen said, If the king doesn't explain it for her, he'll kill himself.

source_sentence: 王言：「汝能自殺善，我宮中多有婦女，不用汝為。」
translation: The king said, Good, you can kill yourself; there are many women in my palace who won't need you to do it.

source_sentence: 師曰：「癡男子坐婦欲殺身也」。
translation: The teacher said, A foolish man sitting in a woman wants to kill her body.

source_sentence: （二二）昔有一國，五穀熟成人民安寧，無有疾病，晝夜伎樂無憂也。
translation: (21) Once there was a country in which the five grains ripened and the people became peaceful, with no illness and no sorrow of day or night's entertainment.

source_sentence: 王問群臣：「我聞天下有禍，何類？」
translation: The king asked the ministers, I've heard that there's harm in the world; what kind is it?

source_sentence: 答曰：「臣亦不見也。」
translation: He replied, The minister doesn't see it either.

source_sentence: 王便使一臣至隣國求買之。
translation: The king then sent a minister to the neighboring country to buy it.

source_sentence: 天神則化作一人，於市中賣之，狀類如猪持鐵鎖繫縛。
translation: The gods then transformed into a man who was sold in the marketplace, shaped like a pig holding an iron chain and bound.

source_sentence: 臣問：「此名何等？」
translation: The minister asked, What's the name of this?

source_sentence: 答曰：「禍母。」
translation: He answered, Woeful mother.

source_sentence: 曰：「賣幾錢？」
translation: He said, How much money will you sell?

source_sentence: 曰：「千萬。」
translation: He said, Ten thousand.

source_sentence: 臣便顧之，問曰：「此何等食？」
translation: The minister then looked at him and asked, What's this food?

source_sentence: 曰：「日食一升針。」
translation: He said, Eat a sheng of needles every day.

source_sentence: 臣便家家發求針，如是人民兩兩三三相逢求針，使至諸郡縣擾亂，在所患毒無憀。
translation: The ministers then went home and asked for a needle, and thus when two, two, three, or three people met to ask for a needle, they were sent to the counties and towns in turmoil, where they suffered from poison and no anger.

source_sentence: 臣白王：「此禍母致使民亂，男女失業，欲殺棄之。」
translation: The ministers said to the king, This is a misfortune that causes the people to become confused and men and women who lose their work want to kill and abandon them.

source_sentence: 王言：「大善！」
translation: The king said, Great good!

source_sentence: 便於城外，刺不入斫不傷掊不死，積薪燒之，身體赤如火，便走出，過里燒里、過市燒市、入城燒城。
translation: He then went outside the city, didn't enter it, didn't harm it, didn't burn it, and didn't die; he accumulated firewood and burned it, his body red like fire, and then left.

source_sentence: 如是過國，遂擾亂人民飢餓坐厭。
translation: Such a transgression would disturb the people and cause them to starve and sit in distress.

source_sentence: 樂買禍所致。
translation: They're happy to buy things that are the result of misfortune.

source_sentence: （二三）昔有鸚鵡，飛集他山中，山中百鳥畜獸，轉相重愛不相殘害。
translation: (23) Once, there was a parrot that flew to another mountain and gathered hundreds of birds and animals in the mountain, which became loved by each other and didn't harm each other.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡自念：「雖爾，不可久也，當歸耳。」
translation: The parrot thought to himself, Even so, it won't be long before I return.

source_sentence: 便去。
translation: He then departed.

source_sentence: 却後數月，大山失火四面皆然，鸚鵡遙見便入水，以羽翅取水飛上空中，
translation: Several months later the great mountain disappeared and all four sides were destroyed by fire. Seeing this from a distance, the parrot entered the water and flew up into the air with its wings to get some water.

source_sentence: 以衣毛間水灑之，欲滅大火。
translation: He sprinkled it with water between the hair on his clothes in order to extinguish the great fire.

source_sentence: 如是往來。
translation: Thus, this is the past and future.

source_sentence: 往來天神言：「咄鸚鵡！
translation: The gods of the past and future said, Duh-parrot!

source_sentence: 汝何以癡？
translation: Why are you deluded?

source_sentence: 千里之火寧為汝兩翅水滅乎？」
translation: How could a thousand miles of fire be extinguished by your two-winged water?

source_sentence: 鸚鵡曰：「我由知而不滅也，我曾客是山中，山中百鳥畜獸皆仁善，悉為兄弟，
translation: The parrot said, “I know that you won’t perish. I was once a guest on this mountain. All the birds and animals there are kind and benevolent; all of them are brothers.

source_sentence: 我不忍見之耳。」
translation: I can't bear to see it.

source_sentence: 天神感其至意，則雨滅火也。
translation: The gods and goddesses were moved by his sincerity, and the rain ceased the fire.

source_sentence: （二四）佛與比丘俱行，避入草中。
translation: (24) When the Buddha and the monks were walking together, they avoided entering the grass.

source_sentence: 阿難問佛：「何因捨道行草中？」
translation: Ānanda asked the Buddha, Why did you abandon the path and walk in the grass?

source_sentence: 佛言：「前有賊，後三梵志當為賊所得。」
translation: The Buddha said, There were thieves before, and the next three priests will be obtained by thieves.

source_sentence: 三人後來，見道邊有聚金，便止共取，令一人還聚中市飯，一人取毒著飯中殺二人。
translation: When the three men came back, they saw a pile of gold at the side of the road and stopped together to collect it. One man was allowed to return to the marketplace for food in the middle of the pile but another man put poison into the rice and killed two people.

source_sentence: 「我當獨得金。」
translation: I will get the gold by myself.

source_sentence: 二人復生意，見來便共殺之已，便食毒飯俱死。
translation: When the two men resumed their business, they met each other and killed them together. They then ate the poisonous rice and all died.

source_sentence: 三各生惡意，展轉相殺如是也。
translation: Each of the three gave rise to bad intentions, killing each other in turn like this.

source_sentence: （二五）昔有四姓，藏婦不使人見。
translation: (24) Once, there were four castes that hid their wives and didn't allow others to see them.

source_sentence: 婦值青衣作地窟，與琢銀兒相通。
translation: The woman wore a blue robe and built a cave in the ground, which she shared with Ziqiao.

source_sentence: 夫後覺，婦言：「我生不行，卿莫妄語。」
translation: When the husband later woke up, the woman said, I won't give birth; don't lie to me.

source_sentence: 夫言：「當將汝至神樹所。」
translation: The husband said, I'll take you to the divine tree.

source_sentence: 婦言：「佳。」
translation: The woman said, Good.

source_sentence: 持齋七日入齋室，婦密語琢銀兒：「汝當云何？
translation: On the seventh day of the fast, she entered the abstinence hall, and the woman secretly said to Kauṇḍinya, What will you do?

source_sentence: 汝詐作狂亂頭，於市逢人，抱持牽引之。」
translation: You fraudulently make a mad head and meet people in the marketplace, holding them in your arms and pulling them.

source_sentence: 夫齋竟便將婦出，婦言：「我生不見市，卿將我過市。」
translation: When the purification was over, he took his wife out, and she said, I didn't see the marketplace when I was born, so you led me past the marketplace.

source_sentence: 琢銀兒便抱持臥地在所為，婦便哮呼其夫：「何為使人抱持我？」
translation: The woman then called out to her husband, Why would you have someone take me in your arms?

source_sentence: 夫言：「此狂人耳。」
translation: The husband said, This is a madman's ear.

source_sentence: 夫婦俱到神所叩頭言：「生來不作惡，但為此狂所抱耳。」
translation: The couple both went to the god and bowed their heads, saying, Never did evil in my life; I'm just being held by this madness.

source_sentence: 婦則得活，夫默然而慚，婦人姧詐乃當如是也。
translation: The woman then got a living, but the husband was silent and ashamed, and the woman's deceitfulness would be like this.

source_sentence: （二六）昔有一女行嫡人，諸女共送，於樓上飲食相娛樂。
translation: (26) Once upon a time, there was a woman who was the direct descendant of a throne. The daughters together escorted her upstairs and entertained each other with food and drink.

source_sentence: 橘子墮地，諸女共觀：「誰敢下取得橘來，當共為作飲食。」
translation: When the orange dropped to the ground, the women all observed, Who dares to go down and get an orange? They'll make a drink together.

source_sentence: 當嫁女便下樓，見一童子已取橘去，女言童子：「以橘相與。」
translation: When the bride descended from the tower, she saw a boy who had taken the orange and departed, and the woman said to the boy, Give it to him with the orange.

source_sentence: 童子曰：「汝臨嫁時先至我，許我還橘，不爾不相與。」
translation: The boy said, When you're about to marry, you must first come to me and allow me to return to the orange; otherwise, they won't give it to each other.

source_sentence: 女言：「諾。」
translation: The woman said, Yes.

source_sentence: 童子便與橘，女得持還，眾人共作飲食。
translation: The boy then gave the orange, and the woman was allowed to take it back, and the people made food and drink together.

source_sentence: 送女至夫所，女言：「我有重誓，願先見童子，還為卿婦。」
translation: When she arrived at her husband's place, the woman said, I have a grave vow, wishing to see the boy first and return him as your wife.

source_sentence: 夫便放去。
translation: The husband then released him.

source_sentence: 出城逢賊，女向賊求哀：「我有重誓當解。」
translation: When she leaves the city and meets a thief, the woman says to the thief with pity, I have a grave vow that I will be released.

source_sentence: 賊放去。
translation: The thief released him.

source_sentence: 適前逢噉人鬼，女叩頭願乞解誓，鬼放去。
translation: When she met a hungry ghost before her, the woman bowed her head and begged to be released from her vow, and the ghost released her.

source_sentence: 到童子門，請前坐，童子不干，為設飲食，以私金一餅送之。
translation: He went to the door of the boy’s house and invited him to take his seat in front. The boy, who did not dry up, prepared food and drink for the sake of the boy and gave him a cake of gold that was privately entrusted to him.

source_sentence: 師曰：「如是夫、賊、鬼、童子，四人皆善；
translation: The teacher said, “So it is with the four kinds of good men: thieves, ghosts, and children.

source_sentence: 雖爾，意有所在。
translation: Even so, there's something in the mind.

source_sentence: 或有言夫勝者，為持婦急；
translation: Some people say the husband is superior because he wants to keep his wife in a hurry.

source_sentence: 言賊勝者，為持財物急；
translation: When it comes to the superiority of thieves, they are in a hurry to keep their possessions.

source_sentence: 言鬼勝者，為持飲食急；
translation: The expression “preeminent among the ghosts” refers to the urgency of maintaining food and drink.

source_sentence: 言童子勝者，為謙謙也。」
translation: To say that the boy is superior is to be humble.

source_sentence: （二七）昔有婦人，常曰：「我無所亡。」
translation: (27) Once, there was a woman who always said, I won't die.

source_sentence: 其子取母指鐶擲去水中已，往問母金鐶所在。
translation: After he took his mother's fingernail and tossed it into the water, the boy went to ask her where she was holding the gold bowl.

source_sentence: 母言：「我無所亡。」
translation: The mother said, There's nothing to lose.

source_sentence: 母後日請目連、阿那律、大迦葉飯，時當得魚，遣人於市買魚歸治，於腹中得金鐶，
translation: On the day after his mother had invited Maudgalyāyana, Aniruddha, and Mahākāśyapa to eat at that time, she obtained some fish. She sent someone from the marketplace to buy some fish for a meal before returning home. In her belly she found a piece of gold duck.

source_sentence: 母謂子：「我無所亡。」
translation: The mother said to her child, I won't die.

source_sentence: 子大歡喜往至佛所，問：「我母何因有此不亡之福？」
translation: The son rejoiced greatly and went to the Buddha and asked, What's the reason my mother has this merit of not dying?

source_sentence: 佛言：「昔有一仙人居北，陰寒至冬天，人人悉度山南。
translation: The Buddha said: Once there was a holy man who lived in the north. In the winter months it was cold and everyone crossed the valley to the south of the mountain.

source_sentence: 時有老獨母，貧窮不能行，獨止為眾蓋藏器物。
translation: At the time, there was an old and lonely mother who couldn't walk because she was poor and unable to do so, and she stayed alone for the sake of all the containers and vessels.

source_sentence: 春，人悉來還，母以物一一悉付還其主，眾人皆歡喜。」
translation: In the spring, all the people came and returned, and their mother gave each one of them back to their lord with goods, and everyone rejoiced.

source_sentence: 佛言：「時獨母者是汝母，前世護眾人物故，得是無所亡福耳。」
translation: The Buddha said, The lonely mother at the time is your mother, and it's because you protected people in previous lives that you'll attain this merit without losing anything.

source_sentence: 昔有四姓家子，為離越作小居處則足自容，復作經行處，後壽盡上生忉利天上，
translation: In the past, there were four sons of a family of four families who made a small dwelling place in order to leave home. Their feet supported themselves and they again made a place for meditation. After their life ended, they were reborn in Trāyastriṃśa Heaven.

source_sentence: 得寶舍周匝四千里，所欲自樂，歡喜持天華，散離越屋上。
translation: He obtained a jeweled pavilion four thousand li in circumference. Delighted with what he wished, he joyfully carried heavenly flowers and scattered them over the roof of his dwelling.

source_sentence: 天言：「我作小泥屋耳，乃得好殿舍，念恩故來散華耳。」
translation: The gods said, I made a small mud house for my ears, and then I got a nice palace and scattered flowers in my ears because of your kindness.

source_sentence: （二八）昔有三道人共相問：「汝何因得道？」
translation: (20) Once, there were three people of the Way who asked each other, What's the reason you got the path?

source_sentence: 曰：「我於王國中，觀蒲萄大盛好，至晡時人來折滅取，悉敗狼藉在地，
translation: He said, “In the kingdom of Jambudvīpa, I observed that grapes were so plentiful and good-tasting that when the harvest was over people came to break them up and snatched them away. They all fell into disarray on the ground.

source_sentence: 我見覺無常，緣是得道也。」
translation: The perception of self as impermanent is the condition for attaining the path.

source_sentence: 一人曰：「我於水邊坐，見婦人搖手澡器，臂鐶更相叩，因緣合乃成聲，
translation: One man said, “I sat by the water’s edge. I saw a woman shaking the water bowl with her hands washing it. Her arms joined together and they clapped one after the other to make a sound.

source_sentence: 我緣是得道也。」
translation: The condition of self is the attainment of the path.

source_sentence: 一人曰：「我於蓮華水邊坐，見華盛好，至晡有數十乘車來，人馬於中浴，
translation: One man said, “I sat by the side of the lotus flower and saw that the flowers floated in full bloom. On arriving there were dozens of chariots with carriages drawn by people and horses bathing among them.

source_sentence: 悉取華去，萬物無常乃爾，我覺是得道也。」
translation: They all take the flowers and leave them, and everything is impermanent as it is, so I perceive that this is the way to attain enlightenment.

source_sentence: （二九）昔有梵志，大高才學問反駮論議，造立無端彈易正要，引虛為實牽物連喻，
translation: (21) Once, there was a priest of great talent who studied questions and exchanged arguments in order to establish the correct essentials without endless commentary, citing falsehood as reality and dragging things into conjunction with metaphors.

source_sentence: 莫當之者，諸國遂師之。
translation: Those who shouldn't be taught it, the countries will then teach it.

source_sentence: 後到舍衛國，白日然火行，城中人問曰：「何以故如是？」
translation: When he arrived in Sāvatthī, a fire was raging on the white sun and people in the city asked, Why is it like this?

source_sentence: 曰：「國冥無明，故然火也。」
translation: He said, The country is dark and ignorant, so it's still a fire.

source_sentence: 國王大恥之，而懸鼓城門下，募求明人有能折此人者。
translation: The king was greatly embarrassed by him and hung it at the entrance of the drum city, inviting scholars to find someone who could break this man.

source_sentence: 時有一沙門，入國問之：「何以有此？」
translation: A monk then entered the country and asked, Why is there such a thing?

source_sentence: 答曰：「王恥梵志所為。
translation: He replied, The king shamed the priest for what he did.

source_sentence: 有明者捶鼓。」
translation: There's a wise person who beats the drum.

source_sentence: 沙門舉足踰之，王聞大歡喜，則請沙門梵志上殿飯食。
translation: The king was greatly delighted to hear this. Then he invited the śramaṇa and brāhmaṇa to the upper chamber of the monastery for food and drink.

source_sentence: 沙門語王：「善哉是梵志，智慧明達真是道人，非奴非卒、非擔死人種。」
translation: The ascetic said to the king, Good, this is a priest with wisdom and insight who's really a practitioner of the Way, not a slave or a soldier or a bearer of death.

source_sentence: 梵志默然無以答。
translation: The priest remained silent and had no answer.

source_sentence: 伎樂同時作，便取梵志著糞箕中，掃迹驅逐出國，相傳告語也。
translation: When the music and tricks were performed at the same time, they then took the priest into the dung pit and swept him out of the country to expel him.

source_sentence: （三〇）昔有沙門，飯已減除，粧飾面目，整頓衣被，闚視前後。
translation: (30) Once there was an ascetic whose food had been reduced, his face and eyes adorned with embellishments, his clothes neatly arranged and draped, and he looked ahead and behind.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「此比丘非法乃爾？」
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Is this monk unlawful?

source_sentence: 佛言：「適從女中來，餘態未盡故耳。」
translation: The Buddha said, It's because the remaining states haven't ended when they come from among women.

source_sentence: 比丘則現羅漢道，般泥洹去也。
translation: The monk then manifested the path of the arhat and departed, parinirvāṇa.

source_sentence: （三一）昔舍衛城外有家人婦，為清信女，戒行純具。
translation: (21) Once, there was a family woman outside the city of Śrāvastī who was a woman of pure faith and observed the precepts purely.

source_sentence: 佛自至門分衛，婦以飯著鉢中却作禮，佛言：「種一生十，種十生百，
translation: When the Buddha came to the door and guarded it, the woman put food in her bowl and greeted him. The Buddha said, Sow ten seeds for one lifetime; sow ten seeds for a hundred.

source_sentence: 種百生千，如是生萬生億，得見諦道。」
translation: Seeding a hundred sentient beings for a thousand and thus producing a million sentient beings, he attains the path of seeing the truth.

source_sentence: 其夫不信道德，默於後聽佛呪願，曰：「瞿曇沙門言，何若過甚哉？
translation: The husband did not believe in the Dharma but remained silent and listened to the Buddha’s exhortation. He said, “The words of the śramaṇa Gautama are exceedingly false.

source_sentence: 施一鉢飯乃得爾所福，復見諦道。」
translation: Giving a bowl of rice will then obtain such merit and return to the path of seeing the truths.

source_sentence: 佛言：「卿從何所來？」
translation: The Buddha said, Where did you come from?

source_sentence: 答曰：「從城中來。」
translation: He answered, They came from the city.

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝見尼拘類樹高幾許？」
translation: The Buddha said, Do you see how high are the nyagrodha trees?

source_sentence: 答曰：「高四十里，歲下數萬斛實，其核大如芥子。」
translation: He answered, It's forty miles high and several tens of thousands of hu feet below the year, its kernel is as large as a mustard seed.

source_sentence: 答曰：「少少耳。」
translation: He replied, Very little.

source_sentence: 佛言：「一升乎？」
translation: The Buddha said, Is it one sheng?

source_sentence: 答曰：「一核耳。」
translation: He answered, One is the ear of a nucleus.

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝語何若過乎？
translation: The Buddha said, What's wrong with what you say?

source_sentence: 栽種一芥子，乃高四十里，歲下數十萬子。」
translation: He plants a mustard seed that's 40 miles high and 100,000 seeds below the year.

source_sentence: 答曰：「實爾。」
translation: He replied, Indeed.

source_sentence: 佛言：「地者無知其報力爾，何況歡喜持一鉢飯上佛？
translation: The Buddha said, That person on earth doesn't know the power of their reward, so why wouldn't they rejoice and carry a bowl of rice to the Buddha?

source_sentence: 其福不可稱量。」
translation: Their merit can't be measured.

source_sentence: 夫婦心意開解，應時得須陀洹道也。
translation: The husband and wife's minds are enlightened, and they should then attain the stream entry path.

source_sentence: （三二）昔有沙門，已得阿那含道，於山上煮草染衣。
translation: (32) Once, there was an ascetic who had attained the path of non-returner and cooked grass on a mountain to dye his robes.

source_sentence: 時有失牛者遍求牛，見山上有火煙，便往視，見釜中悉牛骨，鉢化成牛頭，
translation: Someone who lost his cow then searched everywhere for a cow. Seeing the smoke of fire on the mountain, he went to look around and saw all the cow bones in the cauldron and the bowl turned into an ox’s head.

source_sentence: 袈裟化成牛皮，人便以骨繫頭，徇行國中，眾人共見之。
translation: The monks transformed their robes into cow hide and people tied their hair around the Buddha’s neck with a piece of bone. They traveled in various countries, where they were seen by everyone.

source_sentence: 沙彌見日已中，捶楗椎，不見師至，便入戶坐思惟，見師乃人所辱，則往頭面著足言：「何因如此？」
translation: Seeing that the day was over, the novice saw him beating a hammer and not seeing his teacher arrive, so he went into the door to sit and reflected on it.

source_sentence: 曰：「久遠時罪也。」
translation: He said, It's a long-standing offense.

source_sentence: 沙彌言：「可暫歸食。」
translation: The novice said, You may return to eat for a while.

source_sentence: 兩人則放神足俱去。
translation: The two men then released their spiritual feet and departed together.

source_sentence: 沙彌未得道，常有恚未除，顧見清信士及國人，國人乃取我師如此，使龍雨沙石，
translation: As the śrāmaṇer had not yet attained the Way, he always suffered from anguish and could not get rid of it. When he saw the pure faithful monks and the people of his country, the people of that country took my teacher’s example and caused dragons to rain sand and stones on him.

source_sentence: 動此國令之恐怖。
translation: It moves the fear of this country's order.

source_sentence: 念此適竟，四面雨沙，城塢屋室皆悉壞敗。
translation: When he finished thinking this, it rained sand on the four sides, and all the houses and buildings in the city were completely destroyed.

source_sentence: 師言：「我宿命一世屠牛為業，故得此殃耳。
translation: The teacher said, In a previous life, I had slaughtered cattle as my karma, so I've been subject to this misfortune.

source_sentence: 汝何緣作此罪乎？
translation: What is the reason you committed this sin?

source_sentence: 汝去，不須復與我相追。」
translation: Go away, and you won't have to chase after me again.

source_sentence: 師曰：「罪福如是，可不慎矣。」
translation: The teacher said, Such are sins and merits that you shouldn't be careful.

source_sentence: （三三）昔有國王，大臣五人，一臣宿請佛，佛不受，臣則還。
translation: (23) Once there was a king whose ministers were five in number, and one of them invited the Buddha to stay overnight. The Buddha didn't accept it, but the ministers returned.

source_sentence: 因王請佛，佛言：「此臣今必命當終，明日將誰復作福乎？」
translation: The king then invited the Buddha, who said, This minister will surely die now; who will perform another meritorious deed tomorrow?

source_sentence: 臣嘗令相師相之，云：「當兵死。」
translation: I once asked the ministers to see him, saying, You'll die in battle.

source_sentence: 常以兵自衛，己亦拔劍持之，夜極欲臥，以劍付婦持之，婦睡落劍斷其夫頭，
translation: He always guarded himself with his sword and drew his own sword to carry it. When he was lying on the edge of sleep in the middle of the night, he gave his sword to the woman to hold him. The woman fell asleep and cut off her husband’s hair with a sword.

source_sentence: 婦便啼叫言：「君死。」
translation: The woman then cried out in tears and said, You're dead!

source_sentence: 王則召四大臣問：「汝曹營衛之，激修姦變，其婦與相隨而忽至此罪，
translation: The king summoned the four ministers and asked them, “Your majesty, you guarded him. You were engaged in committing a heinous act of sexual misconduct. That woman was accompanied by others and suddenly committed this sin.

source_sentence: 為誰在邊者？」
translation: Who's at the side?

source_sentence: 便斬四臣右手。
translation: He then cut off the four ministers' right hand.

source_sentence: 阿難問佛何因？
translation: Ānanda asked the Buddha, What's the reason?

source_sentence: 佛言：「其夫前世作牧羊兒，婦為白羊母，其四臣前世作賊，見兒牧羊，
translation: The Buddha said, In a previous life, his husband was a sheepherd, and his wife was the mother of white sheep. Those four ministers were thieves in a previous life when they saw their children shedding sheep.

source_sentence: 便呼兒俱舉右手指，令殺白羊母，與五人烹之。
translation: He then called his children together, raised their right fingers, ordered them to kill the white sheep's mother, and cooked it with five people.

source_sentence: 兒啼泣悲哀，殺羊食賊，如是展轉生死，今世共會故，畢其宿命罪也。」
translation: The child cried in pity, killed a sheep and ate a thief, and thus passed away; it's the sin of killing them after their past lives.

source_sentence: （三四）昔有大姓，家富巨億，常好惠施所求不違。
translation: (3) Once upon a time, there was a large family of great wealth with millions of householders who always enjoyed generosity and didn't disobey what they asked for.

source_sentence: 後生一男，無有手足形體似魚，名曰魚身。
translation: Later, a boy born without arms or legs resembling a fish with the shape of a fish is called a fish-body.

source_sentence: 父母終亡襲持家業，寢臥室內又無見者。
translation: His parents died and they inherited the family business, but there was no one to see him sleeping or lying in the room.

source_sentence: 時有力士仰王厨食，恒懷飢乏，獨牽十六車樵，賣以自給，又常不供，
translation: At that time the powerful man respected the king’s cooked food and was constantly hungry. He led sixteen chariots of wooden firewood carts alone to offer it for his own consumption, but he did not always do so.

source_sentence: 詣此四姓求所不足，曰：「累年仰王飲食，常不供足，恒抱飢餓。
translation: Seeking what was insufficient, he said, “For many years I cherished the king’s food and drink but always did not provide for it.

source_sentence: 聞四姓貲財巨億，故來乞匃。」
translation: I've heard that the four castes had a great deal of wealth and money, so I came to beg for it.

source_sentence: 魚身請與相見，示其形體。
translation: The fish was invited to meet him and showed him his body.

source_sentence: 力士退，自思惟：「力石乃爾，近不如無手足人聯取其物。」
translation: The strong man withdrew and thought to himself, So is the strong stone; it's not as close as a man without arms or legs who takes what he has.

source_sentence: 往到佛所問其所疑：「世或有豪尊如國王者死無手足，殖富乃爾，近我筋幹國中無敵，
translation: He went to the Buddha and asked what he doubted, “Some people in the world may be noble like kings who die without arms or legs but grow wealth. If they come near me, there will be no opponent in my country.”

source_sentence: 而常抱餓飲食不足，何緣如此？」
translation: Why is it that they always embrace hunger and lack food and drink?

source_sentence: 佛言：「昔迦葉佛時，魚身與此王共飯佛，汝時貧窮驅使助之，魚身具所當得已與王行，
translation: The Buddha said: Formerly, when the buddha Kasyapa was living together with this king, the flesh of a fish was given to him as food. At that time you were poor and driven away in order to help him.

source_sentence: 而謂王言：『今日有務不得俱行，廢此事為斷我手足無異故。』
translation: He said to the king, 'Today, there's a task that can't be done together, so I abandon this matter in order to cut off my hands and feet because it's no different.'

source_sentence: 時行者今王是也，不行失言者，魚身是也。
translation: The practitioner at the time is now the king, and the one who doesn't speak falsely is the fish-body.

source_sentence: 時貧窮佐助者，汝身是也。」
translation: That's the helper who was poor at the time, which is you.

source_sentence: 於是力士心意開悟，即作沙門得阿羅漢道也。
translation: The strong man then awakened his mind and became an ascetic, attaining the path of the arhat.
